title: The [first-] second part of the no lesse rare, then excellent and stately historie, of the famous and fortunate prince Palmerin of England and Florian de Desart his brother. Containing their knightly deeds of chiualry, successe in their loues pursuite, and other admirable fortunes. Wherein gentlemen may finde choyse of sweete inuentions, and gentlewomen be satisfied in courtly expectations. Translated out of French, by A.M. one of the messengers of her Maiesties chamber.
author: Hurtado, Luis, ca. 1510-ca. 1598, attributed name.
publisher: Printed by Thomas Creede, and Bernard Alsop,
notes: Sometimes attributed to Francisco de Morais and to Luis Hurtado.
A translation of parts 1-2 of: Palmerin of England.
In two parts. Part 1 lacks title page; part 2 has separate title page; title and imprint taken from part 2 title page.
Signatures: part 1: A-O (+2 conjugate leaves, the first signed O6, bound after O5) P-2D 2E²  (-A1, 2E2, blank?); part 2: A⁴ B-2F (-A1, blank?).
Reproduction of the original in the Bodleian Library.
